title: TiKV panic for Corruption: file seqno out of range
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
<!-- You can run `tikv-server --version` -->
TiKV
Release Version:   7.5.0-alpha
Edition:           Community
Git Commit Hash:   88aaaa3e7b1e194d389fee6a9831f7491d7f9acd
Git Commit Branch: heads/refs/tags/v7.5.0-alpha
UTC Build Time:    2023-10-10 11:49:32
Rust Version:      rustc 1.67.0-nightly (96ddd32c4 2022-11-14)
Enable Features:   pprof-fp jemalloc mem-profiling portable sse test-engine-kv-rocksdb test-engine-raft-raft-engine cloud-aws cloud-gcp cloud-azure
Profile:           dist_release
### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->

### Steps to reproduce
<!-- If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. -->
disk full test
tikv panic
```
[2023/10/11 18:59:40.586 +08:00] [FATAL] [lib.rs:510] ["unexpected error: Store(Other(Other("[components/raft_log_engine/src/engine.rs:806]: Corruption: file seqno out of range"))), raft_id: 168341, region_id: 168339, thread_id: 0x61"] [backtrace="   0: tikv_util::set_panic_hook::{{closure}}
```

comments_data.body: No other updates as this issue cannot be reproduced on IDC and ksyun environments.
